title: HIGH SCHOOL FOOTBALL: MIAA Football Committee votes 12-5-1 to approve new changes to 2016 playoff format | High School Insider | with Danny Ventura & Jim Clark
text:
By DAN VENTURA
 FRANKLIN - The MIAA Football Committee voted 12-5-1 this morning to approve format changes for the 2016 season. The next step is Monday when the Tournament Management Committee will have an opportunity to review the plan and deliver its opinion.
 The main changes of the new proposal are as follows:
 1) Expand to eight divisions statewide
 *Change names to Divisions 1, 1A, 2, 2A, 3, 3A, 4, 4A
 *Balance the number of teams per division
 *Central Mass. expansion to six divisions
 *Western Mass. remains at four divisions
 2) Develop alignments based upon enrollment
 *Use October 1, 2005 enrollment numbers
 *Place the Boston Public Schools in the lowest two divisions by league alignment
 *Use a .5 multiplier for vocational schools across the state
 *Use a .7 multiplier for the Worcester Public Schools
 *Balance divisions statewide based upon enrollment
 3) Discontinue the second automatic qualifier
 4) Explore the possibility of a rotation for state semi-final matchups.
 A sub-committee was formed to begin the process of properly aligning schools. They will meet next month and present their findings to the MIAA Football Committee in December, so that schools have plenty of time to appeal their placement before the final meeting in February.
